body:
Same here. Windows 7 / x64 / v0.9.16 between 5-10minutes.
I must kill the process and restart syncthing to get connection with the web gui.
I use Syncthing tray and  it say that syncthing is running. My console Output look same.
Syncthing seem working cause the memory usage change from time to time in process explorer.

Error Message:
"Syncthing scheint nicht erreichbar zu sein oder es gibt ein Problem mit Ihrer Internetverbindung. Versuche erneut..."
Mean:
"Syncthing seems to be unavailable or there is a problem with your Internet connection. Try again ..."

I go back to 0.9.15..work fine.

Interesting. Trying to reproduce now.

Does it happen when you leave the UI tab open?

It doesn´t matter. I start Syncthing...the Web Gui open and I do nothing. After 5-10 minutes the error come. And after that, the gui can´t connect to synthing anymore. 
If I close the gui, after some times I can´t connect too.
So I've been running it for half an hour and I don't seem to be having the issue.
Ok, I think I know what's happening.

Can you try a build from: 
http://build.syncthing.net/job/syncthing-branch/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/

Let me know if that fixes it.
I try v0.9.16+1-gb63ca57 now and take a look on it

Same error after ~5min :/

I take a look a netstat. If it is working I find this connection:
 TCP    127.0.0.1:8080         licensing:19221        HERGESTELLT
 TCP    127.0.0.1:8080         licensing:19223        HERGESTELLT
 TCP    127.0.0.1:8080         licensing:19224        HERGESTELLT
 TCP    127.0.0.1:8080         licensing:19225        HERGESTELLT
 TCP    127.0.0.1:19221        licensing:8080         HERGESTELLT
 TCP    127.0.0.1:19222        licensing:8080         WARTEND
 TCP    127.0.0.1:19223        licensing:8080         HERGESTELLT
 TCP    127.0.0.1:19224        licensing:8080         HERGESTELLT
 TCP    127.0.0.1:19225        licensing:8080         HERGESTELLT

After the connection is lost, nothing ist listen on 8080
I've actually seen this myself, tried to reproduce it with the http stress test but failed. Not sure what the root cause is, but the new HTTP+HTTPS listener is likely the problem.

I'm experiencing this issue as well on darwin-amd64 build of 0.9.16.

After about 5-10 minutes, syncthing is no longer listening on 8080. This is using the default configuration. Restarting the daemon brings the web ui back up for another 5-10 mins, rinse, repeat. 

When this happens, the main syncthing port appears to be open and accepting connections, but I've noticed that some things don't sync from the other peers until I restart the daemon on the OS X box. In this case, the OS X box shows as "connected" from the other peer's web ui.

Interestingly enough, I also upgraded to 0.9.16 on armv6 today and have yet to see this issue.
So I am pretty sure the listener gets GCed. As if I add a finalizer, I can see it being GC'ed. The thing I haven't yet worked out is how to tell GC not to do what it does.
If you guys could test this build http://build.syncthing.net/job/syncthing-branch/939/ that'd be awesome. It's 0.9.16 but without the new https thing.

@AudriusButkevicius That's... o_O I wonder if that's because it returns an error for some reason, and http.Serve() returns. We don't have any error checks on that method, unfortunately. Let's add a panic there and see what happens...
@AudriusButkevicius b065b6c7 ?
I doubt that will help. You can debug it by setting finalizers on listeners and invoking gc in version middleware. I am off to work, I can continue working on this out after work.
Also, calling GC just schedules it, doesn't actually do it, so it might take up to two minutes.

Mmm yeah, but we do literally hundreds of GC:s just loading the web UI (`GODEBUG=gctrace=1 STNORESTART=1 syncthing`) so I don't think it's the GC by itself that's the issue, rather that the listener becomes legitimately unused because the http server doesn't serve http any more...
I'll keep it running and check in now and then to see if I can reproduce it
I've been running on darwin-amd64 v0.9.16+1-g8673a6a for about 20 minutes now and the web ui is still accessible.
Another important detail. It gets GCed straight after peek returning an error. If I recall correctly it was a EOF error, so perhaps your panic thing would show the flaw.
Maybe accept returning an error implies tear down, hence serve returns. I think we should perhaps swallow the peek error.

You can probably generate the EOF error via telnet client or bash builtin which I think is
 ": > /dev/tcp/localhost/8080"
Yep, this is it! `: | nc localhost 8080` is an instant panic. Nice catch.
I'll make a test case and fix it.

Build 939 wasn´t aviable for download

Build #940 (18.09.2014 09:27:31) - v0.9.16+1-gb065b6c
syncthing-windows-amd64-v0.9.16+1-gb065b6c.zip

Still working after 1 hour
